issues.description: In the template repository, ArrayHelpers defines a method named `appendElement`, but Stock.java calls `ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray`, which does not exist in the template and will cause a compile error. The solution repository defines `addElementToArray`, but the template itself is inconsistent.
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename `appendElement` in ArrayHelpers.java to `addElementToArray`, or update Stock.java to call `appendElement` instead of `addElementToArray`, so that the method names and signatures match.

issues.description: The ArrayHelpers class defines an appendElement(T[], T) method in the template, but the solution and the Stock class both invoke an addElementToArray(T[], T) method. This inconsistent naming for the same functionality across artifacts will confuse students and prevent the code from compiling as-is.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across all artifacts. Rename appendElement(...) in the template to addElementToArray(...) so that ArrayHelpers defines addElementToArray(T[], T), matching its usage in Stock and the solution repository.
